description: An ancient Greek harbor city in the Argolid (across from the modern village of Porto Cheli) that was abandoned toward the end of the fourth century BCE. Excavated remains include fortification walls (as early as the eighth century BCE), a city with an orthogonal street plan, an industrial quarter, and domestic architecture with evidence for agricultural processing. Parts of the city are now under water due to a rise in sea levels.
details:
A web page with history and reminiscences of the American excavations at Halieis (1962-1980), including many photographs and a scholarly bibliography, is available: http://home.comcast.net/~btse1/halieis/halieis.htm

Halieis (specifically, House 7) is planned as an interactive web environment at Archaeology magazine's Dig Greece website, see: http://www.archaeology.org/diggreece/halieis.html.
